results.title: So long to run
results.creator_credit: Charles Lapp, Vladimir Valenta and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A woman on welfare is forced to take desperate measures to protect her children from her estranged husband and the welfare agency. The husband breaks down the door of her apartment when he suspects that she is entertaining a friend. The welfare officer threatens to remove her children if she continues to see the friend. Panic-stricken, she hides with her children in a borrowed car, but is picked up by the police.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Lapp, Vladimir Valenta and ONF | NFB

results.title: So help me God
results.brief_description: Filmed at Campbelltown Local Court, N.S.W. it follows a number of people from their interviews with a solicitor to appearance before senior magistrate Kevin Flack. Shows the enormous workload and dedication of Legal Aid Solicitors whoo are seen advising their clients. Produced by award-winning documentary maker, Jenny Brockie, the filming took six weeks in total and the makers had secured unprecedented access to Campbelltown local court. All the defendants who feature in this program gave their written consent to be filmed. They include: Heidi - a nineteen year old mother of two, who’s been charged with receiving stolen goods; Dean - a young man charged with trying to break into a tattoo shop and trying to steal a tattoo gun; Joy - a 46 year old woman whose relatives are trying to have her put into a place of care under the Inebriates Act; Marietta - who’s seeking an order to stop her ex-husband’s girlfriend from harrassing her; Robert and Sean - who both face possible jail terms for separate offences of break, enter and steal. We also meet the major legal players at Campbelltown, the Senior Magistrate, Kevin Flack, Legal Aid lawyer - Justin Hutchinson, some private solicitors and the Police Prosecutor.

results.title: So good to share
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Cinevex
results.brief_description: Features wine and winemaking in the Barossa Valley of South Australia by German settlers in 1836. First grapes planted 1847, harvested in 1850. Views of grape picking, pressing and storage. The film shows the general life around the area.

results.title: So far from India
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair and Mira Nair Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary of the complex rhythm of middle class family life in a town in India. Tension occurs when the man, who has immigrated to New York fails to send for his family. He returns home to find many problems facing him.

results.title: Snub Music Magazine
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of the best and most recent English and European music clips shown on BBC Television. The bands represented are among the most innovative and progressive from the independent music scene. The clips combine an exciting and wide range of highly specialised visual effects. Intercut with the clips are interviews with various music industry people such as BBC disc jockey, John Peel. Bands included are Duritti Column, New Order, Gary Clail, M.A.R.R.S. and Algerian group - Fadela.

results.title: Snowy waters
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A brief description of the large-scale hydroelectric schemes being undertaken by the Snowy Mountains Hydro-electric Authority. When completed the scheme will change the geography of an area as large as Switzerland by completely altering the course of streams and rivers. The film shows some of the work undertaken by the scheme including the construction of dams, building of roads and extensive excavations.

results.title: Snowy Mountain Scheme
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
This short film shows the early stages of the Hydro Electric Scheme. Illustrating the difficulties in development and construction through diagrammatic animation. This film was probably shot and completed before the scheme was finished.

results.title: Snowy Mountain riders
results.creator_credit: David Leonard and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
In the Snowy Mountains of southern New South Wales, near Jindabyne, there is to be a horse meeting to honour the first settlers of the district. The film shows the rounding-up and breaking-in of wild brumbies for the picnic race meeting and comments on the change in the district over the years. Narrated by Ron Iddon.
